key_title: Key to the species of Ozothamnus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Puttock, C.F.
source.title: Ozothamnus
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Puttock, C.F. (1999). Ozothamnus. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems with prominent contrasting green ridges decurrent from basal margins
Stems terete or if angular or slightly ridged, then ridges not green
Inner involucral bracts linear; lamina hyaline occasionally with white tips, or white with a hyaline margin
Inner involucral bracts boat-shaped, lamina white to straw-coloured throughout
Leaves revolute, c. linear; inflorescences hemispherical
Leaves flat or recurved, obovate; inflorescences often quite flat-topped
Leaves erect and c. appressed to stem; lamina of involucral bract hyaline
Leaves spreading; lamina of involucral bract white with a hyaline margin
Leaves flat, or if recurved or revolute, margins not completely obscuring the abaxial surface
Leaves revolute, margins completely obscuring the abaxial surface
Leaves spreading, discolorous, dull or obscured by indumentum below
Leaves erect, c. concolorous, glossy below
Inflorescences secund
Inflorescences not secund
Leaves with midribs on lower surface tomentose, upper surface dull, also often tomentose
Leaves with midribs on lower surface glabrous, upper surface shining, glabrous
Leaves glabrous or with few cottony hairs on adaxial surface
Leaves with silky, appressed indumentum on adaxial surface
At least the inner involucral bracts with differentiated, spreading lamina
Involucral bracts all erect or incurved, without differentiated lamina
Leaves cuneate to oblanceolate, apex rounded, white or yellowish beneath
Leaves linear to narrow-oblanceolate or narrow-elliptic, apex acute, greyish beneath
Mature leaves 4–25 (–28) mm long, 1.5–3 mm wide
Mature leaves (22–) 30–125 mm long, 3.5–8.5 mm wide
Leaves recurved to revolute, viscid; capitula cylindric to turbinate; involucral bracts 15–26, reddish in bud; compact alpine or higher subalpine shrubs
Leaves flat, not viscid; capitula campanulate; involucral bracts 28–35, white; shrubs mostly of drier eastern ranges
Capitula turbinate, under 4.5 mm long; not or slightly viscid shrub of lowlands in far east, sweetly spicily aromatic
Capitula subglobose, 5.5–8 mm long; very viscid shrub of north-eastern ranges
Leaves sessile, erect, closely appressed to stems; inflorescences compact terminal clusters
Leaves petiolate; inflorescences hemispherical or corymbose
Leaves distinctly scabrous; erect shrub of swampy heaths and watercourses
Leaves not scabrous; shrubs mostly of dry sites or coasts
Capitula less than 5 mm long; drier foothills to subalps
Capitula 6.5–8 mm long; compact shrub of coastal dunes and cliffs
